meanings.definition: A shrub native to the southwestern United States and Mexico, producing a liquid wax used in cosmetics and skin care products.
meanings.sent1: The jojoba plant grows in dry regions and provides a valuable wax.
meanings.sent2: Many beauty products contain jojoba oil for its skin benefits.
meanings.sent3: Why did the desert plant start a skincare line? To sell its jojoba wax!
meanings.sent4: Her skin glowed like she had been bathing in jojoba essence.
meanings.sent5: The jojoba wax was as precious as liquid gold in the cosmetic industry.

meanings.definition: The liquid wax produced by the jojoba shrub, often used as a moisturizer.
meanings.sent1: Applying jojoba oil to your skin can help keep it hydrated.
meanings.sent2: I prefer using jojoba wax as a natural moisturizer.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dry skin go to the desert? To get some jojoba lotion!
meanings.sent4: Her hands felt as soft as jojoba petals after using the oil.
meanings.sent5: The jojoba moisturizer worked wonders on her rough elbows.
